projects.title: Noisy Ninjas
projects.bodyText:
- A 2D multiplayer game that revolves around the strategic manipulation of sound made in **React**
 -  Players are thrust into a 3 vs 1 scenario, assuming the roles of nimble ninjas or the formidable boss.
 - In this game, ninjas must rely on sound cues to navigate through a dark arena, while the boss possesses a unique talent for detecting sounds. The ultimate objective of the game is for the ninjas to collaborate effectively to take down the boss before the boss can single out and defeat each ninja, one by one.
- **OAuth** Support 
 - Proximity Chat Support 
 - Deployed using **Cloud Amazon Gamelift**

projects.title: PetSprout -  Habit Formation App
projects.bodyText:
- A Habit Development mobile app made using **React Native** for **UofT** students where all features were deeply researched and vetted by a team of psychology students. 
 - Sponsored and endorsed by UofT psychology faculty head **Steve Joordens**. 
 - As **frontend lead** I mentored my junior colleagues (5+ members), nurturing an environment of collaboration code and refinement through code reviews and pair programming.
 - Focused on the theme of gamification through a unique pet system with diverse evolution trees. 
 - Deployed on the **App store** and **google play store** to a class of 150+ students who provided feedback over a 4 month period.

projects.title: Find Dining Scarborough
projects.bodyText:
- Find Dining Scarborough was a website that was designed to showcase local restaurants and also share their unique stories while providing everything a typical food order app does. 
 - Made in conjunction with UofT's community accelerator, **The Bridge**.
 - Awarded The **Best Project by The City of Toronto** amongst our class of 50 in 2020. 
 - Implemented personalized restaurant pages, a map pinpointing nearby dining options, robust search/filter functionality, and a user-driven ratings system.
 - Deployed using **AWS** and **Docker** enabling us to containerize and deploy our application with ease
